meanings.definition: To make subjective or influenced by personal feelings or opinions.
meanings.sent1: She was subjectivising the movie review by sharing her personal thoughts.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys subjectivising his experiences to make them more relatable.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be subjectivising the toy mouse as a real prey.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were subjectivising her perception of reality.
meanings.sent5: By subjectivising the data, he was able to connect with the audience on a deeper level.

meanings.definition: The act of interpreting or perceiving something based on individual perspective.
meanings.sent1: Subjectivising can lead to different understandings of the same event.
meanings.sent2: Her subjectivising of the painting revealed hidden details.
meanings.sent3: The subjectivising of colors made the art class more interesting.
meanings.sent4: His subjectivising of the situation brought a fresh outlook to the problem.
meanings.sent5: The subjectivising of history books made the past come alive for the students.
